alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Kendall; La Salle; McHenry; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 11 at 2:09PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois and northeast Illinois, including the following counties, in north central Illinois, De Kalb, La Salle and Ogle. In northeast Illinois, Kendall and McHenry. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 209 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated an area of moderate to heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... DeKalb, Woodstock, Sycamore, Harvard, Marengo, Sandwich, Genoa, Shabbona, Hampshire, Lake Holiday, Cortland, Hinckley, Somonauk, Kirkland, Waterman, Maple Park, Hebron, Kingston, Malta and Union. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers, creeks, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Kendall; La Salle; McHenry; Ogle
